Jargon Term: fluid backing up into your lungs
Your blood pressures came down nicely and we were able to get the fluid off of your lungs with extra diuretics. You began to feel better and are now ready to go home.

We think the cause of this episode was eating too much salt and missing a dose of your medication. It is extremetly important to take all of your medications as prescribed and to adhere to a low salt diet.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Diet

Jargon Term: Also, you should weigh yourself every morning, and call your doctor if your weight goes up more than 3 lbs in 1 day or 5 pounds in 3 days.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Please get your blood drawn on Thursday to check your electrolytes on the increased lasix.
Medications started: Pravastatin 40mg daily (restart this medicine)
Medications changed: Increase lasix to 40mg daily (Two 20mg tabs)
Follow-up needed for: 1. Blood pressure 2. INR check 3. Weight and respiratory status
